metadata.title: CVE-2022-0391 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in Python, specifically within the urllib.parse module.This module helps break Uniform Resource Locator (URL) strings intocomponents. The issue involves how the urlparse method does not sanitizeinput and allows characters like '\r' and '\n' in the URL path. This flawallows an attacker to input a crafted URL, leading to injection attacks.This flaw affects Python versions prior to 3.10.0b1, 3.9.5, 3.8.11, 3.7.11and 3.6.14.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0391` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm1
libpython2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm1
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm1
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm1
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm1
python2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm1
python2.7-examples - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm1
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

idle-python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm2
libpython3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm2
libpython3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm2
libpython3.5-stdlib - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm2
libpython3.5-testsuite - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm2
python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm2
python3.5-examples - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm2
python3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm2
python3.5-venv - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm1').
python3.5 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm2').
